item.title: Pavement in the road after a blind corner, 17th January
item.description:
Corner of B4070 from Birdlip onto the stroud road The already damaged pavement has been hit again and the pavement slabs are now in the middle Of the road. Someone is going to drive into it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Birdlip, Cotswold

item.title: Crossing sound extremely quiet and barely audible, 17th January
item.description:
Pedestrian crossing outside the Co-op on Salisbury Avenue, Cheltenham. The crossing sound is so quiet you can hardly hear it so it is dangerous. Problem present for a week.

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Deep gouge in road on both sides of the carrigeway, 17th January
item.description:
On the M5 exit south where the slip road meets the a40 and on the opposite side just before the A40 meets the slip road from benhall Cheltenham there is deep gouges in the road which is dangerous for motorcycles. The gouges cause any two wheeled vehicle a real danger as the wheel once inthe crack cause the front wheel to track the direction of the crack and could cause a loss of control of the vehicle. This has happened due to the poor repaiur work recently and as such I have contacted the local newspaper as this could easily cause a fatality. I would suggest you give this matter some importance before you have the death of someone on your hands .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to pavements and poor drainage, 17th January
item.description:
Damage to this area caused by vehicles parking on the pavement. This causes water to build up during heavy rainfall leading to localised flooding and pushes pedestrians onto the busy Stoke Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights are not working, 17th January
item.description:
One light out In the road that runs alongside churchdown club from church road, up to the car park, and I think two not working in the car park itself. It is very dark particularly on the access road making it a hazard for pedestrians walking to or from the car park at night. These lights have not been working all winter I believe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No White Lines, 17th January
item.description:
Please could I ask that white lines be painted down the middle of the road, from the Down Hatherley Traffic lights, right up to and adjoining the lines at Innsworth Traffic lights (a section of road has no white lines whatsoever, only SLOW painted on in both directions. When the sun is shining, around 3pm (or low sunshine) car drivers are being blinded, and now with the very narrow lane, due to the cycle lane works, we can't see the verge at all and with hardly any room to play with, especially with a bus coming towards you, or a lorry, in the opposite direction, I'm afraid an accident will occur. Kind Regards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

email rec 14/01/2024 - Afternoon Here is the picture of the drain, outside number 35 Lancaster Road, please could this be sorted asap, pretty loud every time cars driving over, this we can here from number 6 Lancaster Road! If you need me to walk around I can show you.

item.title: Bins left out, 17th January
item.description:
After receiving letters last year warning all residents about there rubbish and bins being left out after bins days, It seems to have gone on deaf ears, this is various places in St Pauls Walk and Manser/Hudson streets. The letters threatened action, is this not going to be enforced?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, St Paul's Walk, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 17th January
item.description:
11/1/24 email rcvd - I assume that I am writing to the right people. If not, can you please forward to who does look after access on bridleways and copy me in so I know where the request has gone? There's a fallen tree on a bridleway at map ref: 1385 9629 near the Green Dragon Inn at Cowley. It's where the bridleway goes from Wards Wood into Cowley Wood. It's blocking the bridelway and making it impassable on horesback. Could you please ask the landowner to clear it away? Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 17th January
item.description:
The drains outside this house are full of leaves and plants as such. Can you let me know are the drains going to be cleaned out soon. Thank you
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines required, 17th January
item.description:
I would like to highlight, that double yellow lines are urgently required on the junction between Windyridge Rd and Roman Hackle Avenue due to the significant hump in the road and large vehicles (for example working vans but also personal vehicles) being constantly parked directly opposite the junction. This limits the visibility and pushes the vehicles coming up the hill in the middle of the road. I've been living in Limber Hill for 3 years now and I can't even list how many times I had a dangerous situation trying to turn right from Windyridge Road. I really hope this could be considered to ensure the resident's safety. Further to that, if double yellow lines could be extended 10-15m into the junction of Roman Hackle Avenue this would help Limber Hill's residents immersively to safely join the traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roman Hackle Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
